snippet: Officials say adding the kiosks with free Internet access will help close the digital divide, while others worry the city may be creating a monopoly.
abstract: New York City officials plan to transform public telephone booths into about 10,000 Wi-Fi hot spots across city; kiosks will provide free Internet access, free domestic calls using cellphones or built-in keypad, charging station for mobile devices and access to city services and directions; project, known as LinkNYC, was awarded to CityBridge consortium, and will be paid for by advertising revenues from kiosks’ digital displays.
lead_paragraph: Officials say adding the kiosks with free Internet access will help close the digital divide, while others worry the city may be creating a monopoly.

headline.main: Pay Phones in New York City Will Become Free Wi-Fi Hot Spots
headline.print_headline: Old Pay Phones to Evolve Into Free Wi-Fi Hot Spots
